intro: Pedicularis resupinata f. oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant features opposite leaves and produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its tubular flowers are adapted for pollination by bees and other insects. This variety is distinguished by its unique leaf arrangement and is often found in rocky, high-altitude environments.
